We need to read docstring: PlanckianJitter applies Planckian Jitter to input image, simulating color temperature variations in illumination. It adjusts color based on Planck's law, simulating warm to cool color casts. It has mode (blackbody or cied), temperature_limit range, sampling_method (uniform or gaussian), probability p. It preserves brightness, ensures physically plausible correlated changes across channels.

So summary: a transform that randomly changes image color temperature according to physics-based models (blackbody radiation or CIE D illuminants), sampling temperature within a range, optionally using uniform or Gaussian distribution, applied with probability p.

Business intent: augment image data for computer vision models to be robust to natural lighting variations, simulate different times of day, improve color constancy, generate synthetic data matching real-world illumination.

Keywords: color temperature, blackbody radiation, CIE illuminants, image augmentation, physics-based color shift, lighting simulation, data augmentation, computer vision, illumination variation, correlated channel adjustment.
